body_html:
@panyx0718 the reason for

what's the reason to faover "/device:GPU:0" over "/gpu:0"? It seems the "device:" is redundant and avoiding it allows to keep backward compatibility?

see @vrv comment here: #11697 (comment)
It seems that /device:XXX:x is desired way to report supported devices.. in our effort to add SYCL we have been advised to use /device:SYCL:x
That inconsitency in the way how devices are reported makes testing generalisation painful.
The backward compatiblity is intact as you still can register /gpu:0 I believe that the device gets "canonicalized to new style names" (#11697 (comment))

One solution to keep backward compatibility with old RunMetadata is to support all device naming schemes, instead of just replacing them.

That's really good point! Will do that!

body:
@panyx0718 the reason for 
> what's the reason to faover "/device:GPU:0" over "/gpu:0"? It seems the "device:" is redundant and avoiding it allows to keep backward compatibility?

see @vrv comment here: https://github.com/tensorflow/tensorflow/pull/11697#issuecomment-317800870 
It seems that /device:XXX:x is desired way to report supported devices.. in our effort to add SYCL we have been advised to use /device:SYCL:x 
That inconsitency in the way how devices are reported makes testing generalisation painful.
The backward compatiblity is intact as you still can register /gpu:0 I believe that the device gets "canonicalized to new style names" (https://github.com/tensorflow/tensorflow/pull/11697#issuecomment-318111065)

> One solution to keep backward compatibility with old RunMetadata is to support all device naming schemes, instead of just replacing them.

That's really good point! Will do that!
